hero-section.title:
Any Chain, Any App, All Users.
One Push Chain.
hero-section.description:
The first Layer 1 built for Universal Apps. 
Build & Deploy once, onboard users from any chain.
hero-section.primary-button-title: Start your builder's journey with Push Chain!

header.main-text: Built on innovations to eliminate fragmenation!
header.other-text: Push is the only Universal Layer 1 you will ever need!

box1.bodytext: Push Chain supports transactions from any blockchain. Users can pay gas in any token — No need for bridging.
box1.imagealt: Illustration showing different blockchain logos falling in a pin ball machine.

box2.bodytext: Let any wallet from any chain connect, interact, and transact. Break web3 barriers by using social login or email. User get to decide on Push Chain.
box2.imagealt: Illustration showing Metamask wallet, Phantom Wallet, etc coming out of a big wallet with Push Chain logo on it.
box2.imagetitle: Supports any existing wallets like Metamask, Phantom, etc along with social login

box3.bodytext: Deploy with zero on-chain code. Turn your native app into a universal app in minutes.
box3.imagealt: Illustration showing Ethereum Virtual Machine logo spinning and saying 100% EVM Compatibility.
box3.imagetitle: Zero on-chain code changes required, 100% EVM Compatible.

box4.bodytext: Build once, run cross chain, multi step experiences  with a single, future-proof contract.
box4.imagealt: Illustration showing lines of code required for Push Protocol integration
box4.imagetitle: Deploy once, instantly become compatible with all supported chains (EVM or non-EVM).

box5.bodytext: Let’s users pay gas in any token, on any chain without bridging.
box5.imagealt: Illustration showing different logos of Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana rotating around Push Chain
box5.imagetitle: Supports any token of any chain for transactions.

box6.bodytext: Build atomic, composable apps across web3. Create never seen before app experiences, by having multiple users of different chains transact with the same app.
box6.imagealt: Illustration showing different tetris blocks entering a wormhole and Push Chain logo emerging from the other end.
box6.imagetitle: Transactions from any chain finalize on Push Chain, enabling users of any chain to natively use the same app aka Universal Execution Layer.

box7.bodytext: Access account and state data from other chains in your smart contract.
box7.imagealt: Illustration showing Push Chain growing in blocks style animation.
box7.imagetitle: (Roadmap) Shared State allows access to account and state data from other chains in your smart contract.

box8.bodytext: Trigger, validate, and complete transactions across any chain using your smart contract.
box8.imagealt: Illustration showing tetris blocks in different colors merging and changing.
box8.imagetitle: (Roadmap) Programmable Solvers allow users to trigger, validate, and complete transactions across any chain using your smart contract.

footer.title: your app's user base by going universal
footer.ctatitle: Deploy once, 10x your userbase. Visit Developer Docs.

article1.text: We saw a driven, innovative builder who was deeply committed to Ethereum's growth and success.

article2.text: The company hopes to address the lack of cross-blockchain communication with easy messaging tools.

article3.text: Push Protocol is the “Missing piece of Web3” that is required to bring the UX of Web2 to Web3.

article4.text: Decentralized push notifications may transform what dapps can do.

article5.text: Web3 communication networks and decentralized teams go together like peanut butter and jelly.

article6.text: Unstoppable Domains launches badge-gated group chat feature for username holders powered by Push Chat.

article7.text: Collaboration with Push Protocol aims to fend off misinformation and scams.

article8.text: Push Protocol, recently completed Phase 1 of its (BRB) dev tour in India. A hackathon participant successfully solved a challenge brought forth by our team: Quantum Proofing Ethereum accounts.

article9.text: Push Chain, a Layer 1 blockchain focused on chain abstraction and building web3 applications accessible across different networks. Push Chain aims to address fragmented user experiences and scalability issues.

article10.text: Push Chain aims to solve the problems of fragmented user experience and scalability.

article11.text: Architecture supports interactions across EVM and non-EVM ecosystems, allowing developers to access wallet states from distinct networks without relying on fragmented infrastructure.

Frequently
Asked
Questions
short-faq-snippet.title-aria-label: Common questions and answers about Push Chain

what-is-push-chain.question: What is Push Chain?
what-is-push-chain.answer-1: We are building Push Chain, a <1>shared state L1</1> blockchain for <3>Universal Apps</3>. Push Chain enables txs from any chain (Eth, Solana, EVM, or non-EVM) enabling apps from any chain to be accessed by the users of any chain (polymarket from any chain, pump.fun from any chain, etc).
what-is-push-chain.answer-2: It enables apps to be completely interoperable by allowing developers to deploy a single universal smart contract on Push Chain. It also enables new paradigm of apps where users of all chains can come together for shared app experiences (universal AI agents, socials, etc).

how-does-push-chain-work.question: How does Push Chain work?
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-1: Push Chain is a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) L1 blockchain that is designed to eliminate fragmentation across all chains.
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-2: It leverages on several innovations such as specialized validators, off-chain relayers and generalized solvers working in tandem to ensure a user or developer is able to read and write on any chain. This eliminates the silos of different chains, wallet conventions, liquidity fragmentation and more.
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-3: It introduces some groundbreaking innovations such as:
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-4: <1>Fee and Wallet abstraction</1> - allowing wallets/users of any chain to interact natively while being on the chain of their choice.
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-5: <1>Universal Wallet</1> - ensuring user can login via social or email and still have non-custodial wallets created for them for all chains (Ethereum, Bitcoin, Solana, etc).
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-6: <1>Shared State</1> - enabling developers to read the state of any wallet or smart contract of any other blockchain via smart contract on Push Chain.
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-7: <1>Programmable Solvers</1> - ensures that a developer can create a basic path for cross chain actions (write actions) based on the shared state.
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-8: <1>Universal Smart Contracts</1> - giving developers ability to use shared state and generalized solvers for read and write action in chain agnostic fashion. And enables users to use fees and wallet abstraction to access any app or any chain without any hassle.
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-9: Push Chain uses all these innovations to enable reading (shared state) or writing to different chains (programmable solvers), all controlled by the universal smart contract. The fee and wallet abstraction further enables a seamless, user centric approach as the learnings for a user is abstracted away no matter from what chain they chose to interact.
how-does-push-chain-work.answer-10: This results in <1>universal applications</1> for web3. In this paradigm, instead of being a user of "Uniswap on Ethereum," "Uniswap on Polygon," or "Uniswap on Arbitrum," a person simply becomes a <3>user of Uniswap</3>.

why-is-push-chain-unique.question: Why is Push Chain unique for users?
why-is-push-chain-unique.answer-1: Push Chain addresses specific gaps in the existing blockchains, such as interoperability, state access across chains, programmable solvers and wallet abstraction resulting in a <1>full stack interop</1>. While existing blockchains are robust, they operate in their own eco-system and an aggregator to unite these chains are needed.
why-is-push-chain-unique.answer-2: Push Chain's focus is on being a <1>shared state chain</1> for universal (interoperable) applications acting as a unifying layer where all chains can come together and use PC as universal hub or do settlement between them.
why-is-push-chain-unique.answer-3: PC offers a new paradigm of web3 that works from <1>Any Chain.</1> For <3>Any Wallet/User.</3> And is suitable for <5>Any App.</5>

push-chain-grants.question: How do I get involved with Push Chain Grants?
push-chain-grants.answer-1: While we are thrilled with the early interest coming from developers to build universal apps, we are still in the governance phase for ratifying our evolution from Push Protocol to Push Chain and hence do not have a grants program now.
push-chain-grants.answer-2: This will change very soon once the community approves of Push Chain! Meanwhile, to frontrun other grantees, please drop us an email at <1>team@push.org</1> with the subject line as <3>Grant MEOW</3> and your app idea. Or, simply follow <5>@PushChain</5> for more updates around the grants program and its release.

push-protocol-future.question: What will happen to Push Protocol?
push-protocol-future.answer-1: Today's push notification and chat protocols will benefit significantly from being built on top of Push Chain. A dedicated section of the team will focus on maintaining and enhancing these protocols, ensuring they remain the de-facto standard in their respective domains.
push-protocol-future.answer-2: By aligning with Push Chain, notifications and chat sent through the protocols will be processed as transactions on the chain. This integration not only enables these protocols to accrue value but also marks the beginning of a new chapter in their evolution, further enhancing their utility and impact within the web3 ecosystem.

learn-more.question: I want to learn more?
learn-more.answer-1: That's awesome! you can head to our <1>Knowledge Base</1> section to learn everything in depth.
learn-more.answer-2: If you are a FAQ type of a person, then simply head to our <1>Detailed FAQ</1> for more info.
